Dates of inspection: Aug 21 Sep 07 Sep 18 Sep 30 Oct 13 Oct 25
Physical conditions (A) Evidence: The upper portions of this system have been quite stable this year.
Physical conditions (B) Particulars: The R/H branch was consistently accessable this year, partly due the consistently good water levels.
Physical conditions (C) Water levels: Consistently good water levels through the spawning period. Flooding during the last two weeks of October.
Biological conditions (D) Particulars: Up to 1km. in R/H branch. Up to 1.5 km. in Center branch. Up to 1 km. in L/H branch.
Biological conditions (E) Predators comm: Moderate impact from birds. Minimal impact from bears.
Biological conditions (G) New obstructio: The rock falls in the center branch were not passable during low water conditions, but there was a small number of fish above falls. A 1m. log jam has formed 100 m. above the creek fork, (200 m. from estuary.) in the L/H branch. It appears impassable at this time, but it should be looked at next year.
Comments: The timing on the chums seemed earlier this year than normal, as I was expecting to see more fresh fish on my last walk on 25-Oct.
